page.title: 10Religion In Gunton Area
page.content: Although the area has three churches only one of these is used regularly. Hanworth Church has 2 services a month. It is part of a combined parish of several villages. Alby Church,dedicated to st. Ethelbert, has been disused since 1984. Parishioners join the village of Twaite for worship. Both these churches are of flint and tile. Gunton chapel was declared redundant in 1980 but was not deconsecrated and is used for special services. It was designed by Robert Adam in 1769, and appears as a classical temple. It has a magnificent moulded ceiling. In times past it was attended by estate workers but when tied cottages became empty with the change in agricultural methods the "flock"dwindled. Now that the cottages are owner-occupied and the Hall converted to many units the chapel may be re-commissioned.
